english_translation: Narrated by Sa'd: Umar ibn al-Khattab sought permission to enter upon the Prophet ﷺ while Qurayshi women were with him, asking him and demanding from him with their voices raised above his. When they heard the voice of Umar, they hurried behind the curtains. Umar entered and the Prophet ﷺ was laughing. Umar said: May Allah preserve your teeth, O Prophet ﷺ, what are you laughing at? He said: I am amazed at these women who ask me and demand from me with their voices raised above mine. When they heard your voice, they hurried behind the curtain. Umar said: O enemies of yourselves, do you fear me and behave boldly toward the Prophet ﷺ? They said: Yes, you are harsher and rougher. The Prophet ﷺ said: Hush! Then he said: Satan has never heard your voice treading a path except that he treads a different path.

english_translation: Narrated by Salem ibn Abi al-Ja'd: A man came to Ibn Abbas after his sight had been taken. He said: O Abdullah ibn Abbas, what is your opinion regarding a man who killed a believer intentionally? He said: His recompense is Hell, abiding therein, and Allah's anger is upon him, and He has cursed him, and has prepared for him a great punishment (referring to Quran 4:93). He said: What if he repented and believed and performed righteous deeds and then was guided aright? He said: How can he do so, may his mother be bereft of him, the guidance! By the One in Whose hand is the soul of Abdullah, I heard your Prophet ﷺ say: The mother of the one who kills a believer intentionally will be bereaved. He will come on the Day of Judgment with his head hanging by his right hand or his left hand, with his killer grasping him by his other hand. His jugular vein will gush with blood in front of the Throne of the Merciful. He will say: O Lord, ask this one about why he killed me. By the One in Whose hand is the soul of Abdullah, this verse was revealed and no verse abrogated it until your Prophet ﷺ was taken, and no proof came down after it.

english_translation: Narrated by Abdullah ibn Unaays: I was in a gathering of Banu Salamah and I was the youngest of them. They said: Who will ask the Prophet ﷺ about the night of Qadr on the morning of the twenty-first of Ramadan? So I left and met with the Prophet ﷺ for the Maghrib prayer. Then I stood at his house door. He passed by me and said: Enter. So I entered and food was brought to him. He saw me refraining from it due to its scarcity. When he finished, he said: Hand me my sandals. He stood and I stood with him. He said: Did you have a need? I said: Yes, a group from Banu Salamah sent me to you to ask you about the Night of Qadr. He said: What night is it? I said: The twenty-second. He said: That is the night. Then he returned and said: Or the following one, meaning the night of the twenty-third.

english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurayrah: A woman came to the Prophet ﷺ and offered herself to him. He said to her: Sit. She sat for a while. He said: Sit, may Allah bless you. We have no need for you, but will you entrust your matter to me? She said: Yes. So the Prophet ﷺ looked at the faces of the people and called a man and said: I wish to marry you to this woman if you are willing. She said: I am content with what you approve for me, O Prophet ﷺ. Then he said to the man: Do you have anything? He said: No, by Allah. He said: Go to the women. So he went to them and did not find anything with them. He said: How much of the Quran do you memorize? He said: Surah al-Baqarah or the one after it. He said: Go and teach her twenty verses, and she will be your wife.

english_translation: Narrated to Ali ibn Abi Talib: The people have become separated from what they hear from you. If the Prophet ﷺ gave you a covenant, narrate it to us. He said: The Prophet ﷺ did not give me a covenant that he did not give to the people except that in the sheath of my sword is a document. In it: Verily Ibrahim made Makkah sacred, and I make Madinah sacred. It is sacred between its two lava fields. No tree is cut from it except for fodder, and no weapon is carried in it for fighting. Whoever commits an innovation, it is upon him, and whoever commits an innovation or harbors an innovator, upon him is the curse of Allah, the angels, and all people together. Neither substitution nor compensation is accepted from him. The believers are equal in blood, and the lowest of them seeks protection in their covenant. They are one hand against those other than them. No believer is killed for a non-believer, and no one with a covenant is killed while in his covenant.
